alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Hendry; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Collier, northern Mainland Monroe, central Miami-Dade and southwestern Hendry Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 200 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Naples to near Chokoloskee to 11 miles west of Everglades National Park. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Naples, Marco Island, Chokoloskee, Immokalee, Ave Maria, Golden Gate Estates, Everglades City, Orangetree, Golden Gate, Fortymile Bend, Vineyards, Royal Palm Hammock, Naples Park, Felda, Marco Island Airport, Shark Valley Obs Tower, Naples Manor, Plantation Island, Loop Road Ee Center and Carnestown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Hendry; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
